def_en: If people or animals are alive, they are not dead.
If you say that someone seems alive, you mean that they seem to be very lively and to enjoy everything that they do.

def_cn: 继续存在的;在起作用的
def_en: If an activity, organization, or situation is alive, it continues to exist or function.
If a place is alive with something, there are a lot of people or things there and it seems busy or exciting.

def_cn: 注意到的；意识到的；觉察到的
def_en: If you are alive to a situation or problem, you are aware of it and realize how important it is.

def_cn: （使）恢复生机；（使）再度活跃
def_en: If people, places, or events come alive, they start to be lively again after a quiet period. If someone or something brings them alive, they cause them to come alive.

def_cn: （使）变得生动；（使）变得有趣；（使）显得逼真
def_en: If a story or description comes alive, it becomes interesting, lively, or realistic. If someone or something brings it alive, they make it seem more interesting, lively, or realistic.

def_cn: 将被生吞活剥；将被彻底打败
def_en: If you say that someone will be eaten alive, you mean that they will be completely destroyed or defeated by someone who is much stronger.

def_cn: 活蹦乱跳的；健壮的；活跃的
def_en: If you say that someone or something is alive and kicking, you are emphasizing not only that they continue to survive, but also that they are very active.
If you say that someone or something is alive and well, you are emphasizing that they continue to survive.
